turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Did you hear a shot fired?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: No. I was in the shower.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: So at some point in the -- twenty minutes you were in the shower, your father was shot?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: But you didn't hear the shot, because you were in the shower.

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: Yes. I was washing my hair.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Miss Windham, can you tell us what you'd been doing earlier in the day?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: I got up, went to Starbucks, went to the gym, got a perm, and came home.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Where you got in the shower.

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Yes, Your Honor. Had you ever gotten a perm before, Miss Windham?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: How many, would you say?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: Two a year since I was twelve. You do the math.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You know, a girl in my sorority, Tracy Marcinko, got a perm once. Even though we all told her not to. Curls really weren't the right look for her --  She didn't have your bone structure.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Chutney, why is it that Tracy Marcinko's curls were ruined when she got hosed down?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: Because they got wet.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: That's right. Because isn't the first cardinal rule of perm maintenance that you are forbidden to wet your hair for at least twenty-four hours after getting a perm at the risk of de-activating the ammonium thiglycolate?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: And if you in fact, heard the gunshot, then Brooke Windham wouldn't have had time to hide the gun before you got downstairs. Which would mean that you would've had to have found Mrs. Windham with a gun in her hand to make your story sound plausible. Isn't that right?

turns.speaker: CHUTNEY
turns.text: She's younger than I am. Did she tell you that? How would you feel if your father married someone younger than you?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You, however, had time to hide the gun, didn't you, Chutney? After you shot your father?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Dewey Newcomb?

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Who's askin'?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm Elle Woods. Ms. Bonafante's attorney.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Come again?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Due to the fact that you retained the residence, Ms. Bonafante is entitled to full ownership of the canine property in question and we will be enforcing said ownership immediately.

turns.speaker: DEWEY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Tell him, Paulette.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: All I know is -- it's not Brooke.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: That's touching, Elle, but we need an alibi.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Did you get it?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Yes. But I can't tell you what it is.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Why the hell not?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I promised her I'd keep it secret. I can't break the bonds of sisterhood!

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: He's gay -- he isn't Brooke's lover! He's making it up. Whoever killed Heyworth is paying him off.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Good work today, Ms. Woods.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Thank you!

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Sit down.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Is everything okay?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: You followed your intuition today and you were right on target. I should've listened.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: About the alibi --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm sorry, but --

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: I'm impressed that you took the initiative to go there and get it. That's what makes a good lawyer. And on top of that, you gained the client's trust and kept it. That's what makes a great lawyer. You're smart, Elle. Smarter than most of the guys I have on my payroll.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: I think it's time discuss your career path. Have you thought about where you might be a summer associate?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Not really. I know how competitive it all is --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You're hitting on me?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: You're a beautiful girl, Elle.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: So everything you just said --

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: I'm a man who knows what I want.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: You're not going up there.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Yes, I am.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: I do. I'm not allowing it.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: But you agreed last night. In the office? When we were discussing my "career"?

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: What did you see when you entered the house?

turns.speaker: ENRIQUE
turns.text: I saw Mrs. Windham standing over the body of Mr. Windham.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Was she carrying a weapon?

turns.speaker: ENRIQUE
turns.text: No, she was crying her eyes out.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: So she was distraught that her husband was dead?

turns.speaker: ENRIQUE
turns.text: Oh, yes. Mrs. Windham is the most sweet, wonderful woman I know. I have loved her since the day she hired me. She could never do something this awful. I know this because we are very close.

turns.speaker: DONOVAN
turns.text: Mr. Salvatore, do you have any proof that you and Mrs. Windham were having an affair?

turns.speaker: ENRIQUE
turns.text: Just the love in my heart.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: Donovan's firm is defending a major murder case and his caseload is so heavy he's taking on first year interns.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: He chose them already?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Why didn't you call me?

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: We spend a beautiful night together and then I never hear from you again?

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: I'm sorry?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: For what? Breaking my heart or ruining sex for me with any other man?

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: Uh -- both?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Forget it. I've already spent too many hours crying over you.

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court Rule 3:03.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: See?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR STROMWELL
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: Aristotle.

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR STROMWELL
turns.text: Would you be willing to stake your life on it?

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: I think so...

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR STROMWELL
turns.text: How about --

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR STROMWELL
turns.text: -- his life?

turns.speaker: DORKY DAVID
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: PROFESSOR STROMWELL
turns.text: Well, I recommend knowing before speaking. The law leaves much room for interpretation -- but very little for self-doubt.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You can't even imagine.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: Spill.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: After you went to all that trouble?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Well, what am I supposed to do? He's engaged! She's got the family six- carat on her bony, unpolished finger.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: You're asking the wrong girl. I'm with my guy eight years and then one day it's "I met someone else. Move out."

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What'd you do?

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: Cried a lot and gained twenty pounds. Dewey kept the trailer and my precious baby Rufus. I got jackcrap.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: I didn't even get to go to his birthday party.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: What could I do?  He's a man who followed his pecker to greener pastures. I'm a middle- aged high-school dropout with stretch marks and a fat ass. Happens every day. At least to women like me.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: That's terrible!

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: So, what's this Sarah got that you don't? Three tits?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: She's from Connecticut. She belongs to his stupid country club.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: Is she as pretty as you?

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: Is she?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: She could use some mascara and some serious highlights, but she's not completely unfortunate-looking.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: Could I be anymore goddamn spastic?  So you're sure, this Warner guy is "the one"?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Definitely! I love him!

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: You showed up Warner in class? You're supposed to be showing up Sarah.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I couldn't help it! It was the most fun I've had since I've been in law school. Not only was I good enough for Warner -- I was better than him. He has to see serious I am now. Even Donovan was impressed, and he's a total hard-ass.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You ready?

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Yes, you are. Go -- you can do this.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: God, that felt great!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Look at him. He's still scratching his head.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: Which must be a nice vacation for his balls...

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I feel so bad for her. I mean, she's in jail! And she's innocent. But I'm the only one who believes her. Donovan totally thinks she's guilty.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: That's because men are big, fat retards who don't -- Oh, my God...

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: So, this is the only interaction you two have ever had?

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: No. Sometimes I say "Okay" instead of "Fine".

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Have you ever considered asking him if he'd like a cold beverage? Or perhaps a neck massage?

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: What's the point?  Look at me.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I am. And I'm looking at a beautiful, fabulous, sexy woman.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: Good one.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Trust me. You've got the equipment, you just need to read the manual.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: And after they set his nose, he came back for his truck and I offered to drive for him since he was still on pain-killers and we spent the whole afternoon together! He was unconscious for part of it, but it was really fun!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm so happy for you!

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: How'd it go at the trial?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Great. Donovan actually said the words "Good work, Ms. Woods". He takes me seriously! Can you believe it?

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: Of course I can believe it. You're going to make a great lawyer.

turns.speaker: PAULETTE
turns.text: You can't go home!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What's the point of staying? All people see when they look at me is blonde hair and big boobs. No one's ever going to take me seriously. The people at law school don't, Warner doesn't -- I don't even think my parents take me seriously. They wanted me to grow up and become a Victoria's Secret model who marries a rock star. Now, for the first time, it seemed like someone expected me to do something better with my life than wear underwear for a living. But I was kidding myself -- Donovan didn't see me as a lawyer. He saw me as a piece of ass just like everyone else. It turns out, I am a joke.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm here to see Brooke Windham.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Licensed attorney or family member?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Uh -- family.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Relation?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm her sister.

turns.speaker: GUARD
turns.text: Name?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Delta. Gamma.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Hi. Sarah Knottingham.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You know her?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Our group is full.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Oh, God, was this like an RSVP thing?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: The idiot speaks.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Although Mr. Huntington makes an excellent point, I have to wonder if the defendant kept a thorough record of each sperm emission made throughout his life?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I believe her, too. I don't think she's having an affair with Enrique.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Too bad you and I are the only ones.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm still can't believe you didn't tell Donovan the alibi.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: It's not my alibi to tell --

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I know. I thought that was very -- classy of you.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Really? Thanks.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Warner can't even do his own laundry.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I know. He has it sent out.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Did you know he got wait-listed when he applied? His father had to make a call.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You're kidding!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Donovan asked to see you before you leave.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: He's already got his coffee -- maybe he needs a donut.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: You almost had me fooled.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Maybe you should sleep with the judge too. Then we can win the case.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: I'm a bitch.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Yes, you are.

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: And Donovan's a scumbag for coming on to you.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Yes, he is.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You're pawning The Rock?!

turns.speaker: SARAH
turns.text: Hell, yes. We've got finals to study for. In Jamaica.

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Can someone please tell Rick that he is not the only Sigma Chi with a big penis?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You guys are so sweet!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Why else would she have flown in from Newport? It's not like she'd Fed Ex a six carat diamond.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Too demure?

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: I think you should go with red. It's the color of confidence.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Well, I don't want to look like I know what's coming...

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What if -- you know -- it's not the night?

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Why else would he be taking you to The Ivy? You've been dating for a year -- it's not like he's trying to impress you.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I don't know! Everything was normal at first and then he said he needed someone more --  Serious!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Serious?! Who the hell does he think he is? You're the most popular month on the USC calendar!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: We still love you. Sisters forever!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Thank you. I love you, too.

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Honey, stop! You have to leave this room -- it's been a week.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Once Warner sees me as a serious law student, he'll want me back. It's a completely brilliant plan!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: But isn't it kind of hard to get into law school?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I have the highest GPA in Delta Gamma!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Here. You're gonna need this.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Your scrunchie?

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: My lucky scrunchie. It helped me pass Spanish.

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Elle, do you know what happened on "Days of Our Lives" yesterday?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Why, yes, Margot, I do. Once again, we joined Hope in the search for her identity. As you know, she's been brainwashed by the evil Stefano --

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: It's Elle!  Guess what I'm doing right this second?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Power yoga?

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Picking out my wedding dress!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Josh proposed!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: No way --

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Keep June first open -- you're one of my bridesmaids. And give Warner our love.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I will...

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Oh, how sweet! You made friends with a nerdy girl.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Margot!

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Speaking of which, can you please put on some party clothes? You look like someone rolled you in something sticky and dragged you through a K- Mart.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I can't believe you guys are actually here -- but this case is important. I'll make it up to you after finals, okay? I -- promise. I really want to do a good job.

turns.speaker: MARGOT
turns.text: Hello! You're like, a lawyer.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Do they just -- put you on the spot like that? Like, all the time?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: The professors? Yeah, they tend to do that. Socratic method.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: And if you don't know the answer, they just kick you out?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: You have Stromwell.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Did she do that to you, too?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: No, but she made me cry once. Not in class -- I waited until I got to my room, but yeah, she can pretty much shrivel your balls -- or you know, your whatevers.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Neat.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Don't worry. It gets better. Who else do you have?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Donovan, Royalton and Levinson.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Speak up in Donovan's class. He likes people with an opinion. Sit in the back for Royalton. He tends to spit when he talks about products liability.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: And make sure you read the footnotes in Levinson's class. That's where all her exam questions come from.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Wow. I'm glad I met you.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Good luck.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Thanks again for your help!

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Don't ask.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I wasn't gonna --

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Okay, if Brooke didn't kill the guy, who did?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: My money's on the angry daughter or the ex-wife.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Explain to me why you're so anti- Brooke.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Uh, for starters, she won't give us an alibi --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Aside from that.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: She's completely untrustworthy.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: She married an old man, she's made a living on telling women they're too fat, she hawks her crap on the Home Shopping Network...

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: A) He's an old man with a really big penis. B) She never told me I was fat. And C) Victoria Principal sells on that network.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: And D) Brooke is obviously hiding something.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: But maybe it's not what you think.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: But maybe it is --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You're kind of being a butt-head right now.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: How do you figure?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Because people aren't always what they seem to be and you refuse to see that. Have a little faith. You might be surprised.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I can't believe you called me a butthead. No one's called me a butt- head since ninth grade.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Maybe not to your face...

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Damn. We can't see her for an hour?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: No, she can't move for an hour.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Mrs. Windham Vandermark?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: We're here from Austen, Platt, Jaret & Donovan --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: She's not!

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Did your daughter ever say anything to you about Brooke and Heyworth's relationship?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: How can you still believe she's innocent?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: You're going to trust the word of a woman who named her child after a condiment? She's ly-ing.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: And you know this for a fact?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Did you see the icky black color of her hair?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I never trust a woman who's not blonde. Except for my friend Serena, but that's only because she's a blonde at heart. That's the whole reason I'm starting the Blonde Legal Defense Fund.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Blondes are discriminated against worldwide! Brooke's a blonde, and people are saying she's sleeping with the cheesy pool boy and shooting her husband. If she was a mousy brunette, it would be, "Oh, the poor widow."

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: You're serious?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Okay, how would it work?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: It would be a full-service law firm, by and for blondes, providing positive blonde role models and community outreach in high blonde areas. I mean, think about it -- name one blonde intellectual role model.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I can't.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: That is a direct result of anti- blonde discrimination!

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Wait -- Hilary Clinton.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: If she were a true blonde, she would've left the cheating bastard. Blondes don't let their husbands get fellated by brunettes and live to tell about it.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: In that case, maybe Heyworth got fellated by a brunette and Brooke caught him.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Exactly how much gorilla sex do you think a sixty-year-old man can take?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: That's not really a topic that keeps me up at night -- but maybe it should.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: What the hell is that for?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: The bags under your eyes. You're an attractive man, but you need to take better care of yourself.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: I don't --  Do that stuff.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Well, you should -- If you look good, you feel good and if you feel good, you project joy into the world.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Projecting joy is not my job.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Fine. Sorry I brought it up.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: You really think I'm attractive?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: For a butt-head? Yes.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: He's gay! Enrique is gay!

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: What?!

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Back up. How do you know he's gay?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Gay men know designers. Straight men don't.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Hey --

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I'm quitting.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Whoa -- Why?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Law school was a mistake. Getting this internship was a mistake.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: What're you talking about? You earned it --

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: So now you're -- ?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Going back to LA. Maybe I can fulfill my destiny as a useless bimbo and join the Swedish Bikini Team. No more navy blue suits. No more panty- hose. No more trying to be something I'm not.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: What if you're trying to be something you are? The hell with Donovan. Stay.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Oh, my God!

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Oh, my God!!

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Up for a celebration dinner?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Are you asking me on a date?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: As long as you realize I'm not just some man-toy you can show off like a trophy.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Then, forget it. Besides, I have an early class tomorrow.

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: So Friday at eight?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: Someone missed you.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Is he the only one?

turns.speaker: EMMETT
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: But I'm not positive it's gonna happen tonight --

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Helloo... he just had lunch with his grandmother. You know he got "The Rock".

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: No -- it's just -- not me.

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: I'm canceling the mixer. We'll blacklist Sigma Chi.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: Thank you, Serena, but I don't think it'll do any good.

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Oh, he is so over on this campus.

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I just don't understand what went wrong --

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: How could this happen?

turns.speaker: ELLE
turns.text: I don't know! I don't know anything any more!  I just need to be by myself.

turns.speaker: SERENA
turns.text: Are you sure?
